item.title: Report E-2024040625
item.description:
Report E-2024040625

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Florida Rock and Tank Lines, Inc. Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver started to drop product when vehicle entered into driver's coned off work area running over the delivery hose and tank connection fitting. This caused a spill of approximately 50 gallons. Driver used spill pads in his attempt to mitigate the area impacted by the spill. The driver was assisted by the store manager. Some fuel went into a storm drain. Customer/shipper, Murphy USA was notified and assigned an emergency environmental response contractor to address remediate the area affected by the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024040519
item.description:
Report E-2024040519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: ZELLWOOD
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of GreenClean Alkaline Cleaner was damaged in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Compliance Technologies (ACT) to remediate the impacted site. ACT personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the Green Clean Alkaline Cleaner-impacted trailer. All impacted absorbents and waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket and taken by ACT crews for disposal. The damaged container of product was overpacked and transported by R+L back to the terminal.
